sentence: Looking at the universe of stocks we cover at Dividend Channel , on 8/29/17, Molson Coors Brewing Co. (Symbol: TAP), Home Depot Inc (Symbol: HD), and Meredith Corp (Symbol: MDP) will all trade ex-dividend for their respective upcoming dividends.

Molson Coors Brewing Co. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.41 on 9/15/17, Home Depot Inc will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.89 on 9/14/17, and Meredith Corp will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.52 on 9/15/17.

As a percentage of TAP's recent stock price of $90.03, this dividend works out to approximately 0.46%, so look for shares of Molson Coors Brewing Co. to trade 0.46% lower - all else being equal - when TAP shares open for trading on 8/29/17.
Similarly, investors should look for HD to open 0.60% lower in price and for MDP to open 0.96% lower, all else being equal.
Below are dividend history charts for TAP, HD, and MDP, showing historical dividends prior to the most recent ones declared.
In general, dividends are not always predictable, following the ups and downs of company profits over time.
Therefore, a good first due diligence step in forming an expectation of annual yield going forward, is looking at the history above, for a sense of stability over time.
This can help in judging whether the most recent dividends from these companies are likely to continue.
If they do continue, the current estimated yields on annualized basis would be 1.82% for Molson Coors Brewing Co., 2.39% for Home Depot Inc, and 3.83% for Meredith Corp.
In Friday trading, Molson Coors Brewing Co. shares are currently up about 0.2%, Home Depot Inc shares are up about 0.6%, and Meredith Corp shares are trading flat on the day.
